turn.0: Hi, I'm your automated assistant. I can answer your questions about History of Persian domes.
turn.1: What are the main types of domes in Persian architecture?
turn.2: An early example of a dome chamber almost completely covered with decorative tilework is that of the Jame Mosque of Yazd (1364), as well as several of the mausoleums of Shah-i-Zinda in Samarkand.
turn.3: What were the different styles of domes used?
turn.4: The development of taller drums also continued into the Timurid period.
turn.5: Are there any other interesting aspects about this article?
turn.6: At the Timurid capital of Samarkand, nobles and rulers in the 14th and 15th centuries began building tombs with double-shelled domes containing cylindrical masonry drums between the shells.
turn.7: What were some of the buildings made?
turn.8: In the Gur-e Amir, built by Timur around 1404, a timber framework on the inner dome supports the outer, bulbous dome.
turn.9: What were some of the materials used?
turn.10: Radial tie-bars at the base of the bulbous dome provide additional structural support.
turn.11: Did they have any other designs?
turn.12: Timber reinforcement rings and rings of stone linked by iron cramps were also used to compensate for the structural problems introduced by using such drums.
